title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
Hi, I have this 820-01700 board which came with no power. After inspection, I saw that the SSD line is shorted on PP2V5_NAND_SSD0, PP1V8_SSD0, and PP0V9_SSD0. Also, U9580 had to be replaced because it was shorting PPBUS_G3H. I replaced U9580 and U9500 to be sure all is good and found that ALL SSD chips from the left side are dead all burned on one of the lines mentioned above. Now there are no electronic issues, but I cannot get it to enter DFU mode, so I was wondering if anyone has experience if it's possible to boot DFU mode only with one side SSD chips. It boosts to 20v goes up to 0.4amps then 0.6, 0.7 and goes back down and again in a loop to 0amps.

Ideas would be appreciated :) Thanks

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
How many NANDs had the board in original configuration?
In case of 5, you can use it with just 4 on one side; once replaced with good ones.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: This board is with 6 NANDs, of which 4 from the left side are dead, the 2 on the right side and the circuit is fine. I tried to force it to DFU mode and restore but it didn't want, it showed and error. Now if got 4 other NANDs from another board and I will try them and again DFU hope it will be good, if not i guess i have to chance them all ?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: 2 on the right side are fine I meant and the circuit on both sides :) I tried to restore with 3 other NANDs on the left side but shows the same eror as before only with the 2 nands from the right side --- Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU state to DFU State---

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
You may need to replace all chips.
Be sure to solder them in the correct location.

Now depends the original size of SSD.
Bigger SSD requires customized T2.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: The ''new'' nands are from an older model but the same and I don't think they are more than 500GB all of them the old and new. What would be the correct location you mean left and right ? I resoldered the new nands on the place where the old were

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
Each chip has a marking code; confirm the capacity.
With correct place I mean the same position in schematic; U8600 must be replaced with chip removed from U8600 place, etc.
You can also buy pre-marked NANDs kit from Aliexpress.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I already soldered them, but not in order now i wouldn't know where they need to go. Can they be from another model and how many they need to be?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
Can be from other model, just need to check size compatibility.
You can downgrade from 512GB to 256GB, for example.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: okey then i have an A1990 just have to confirm the size. Do I need to remove the last 2 from right side chips to install the new ones?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Very likely, if you change the total SSD capacity.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I removed the 2 left from the original SSD chips and I tried to restore and/or revive it just with the 4 new chips, which are probably in the wrong position and still I get the msg  ''Gave up waiting for device to transition from DFU state to DFU State'' - 0xFCA(4042)

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
Can't fix, if the chips are not in correct positions.
Also, should remove power chips for the side where you've ripped off the two NANDs.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Hello. Does it make a difference that I have also replaced U9500. I will try without U9000 and U9080 from the other side maybe it will boot up DFU mode...

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Hi. Something that I didn't mention is that the new ships are black, not silver like the original...

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
Probably not compatible.
You didn't want to mention original chips, not replacement used...

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Sorry about that. Do they have to be silver like the originals and can I use from another board?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Check the marking codes...

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: They are different, but not sure what do they mean :D

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
You had few days to post the codes on the forum.
Google can also help to identify them...

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Ok, thanks, I will try to find them, If not I will ask for advice

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I found chips but the position it's not exactly the same. Mine are 8600/87/88/89/91/92 and the new ones are 86/87/91/92/93/94. Will they work ?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Probably not...

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I consulted the supplier they said they should work... hmmm  o_O

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
You can try.
If doesn't work, need to initialize the chips with dedicated programmer.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: What if I find chips taken out from the same spot, will I then need a programmer, and what kind of programmer is it?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
You don't need the programmer if get the chips from the correct position.

With the programmer you can prepare any chip for the place where you want to use.
[URL unfurl="true"]https://www.jcprogrammer.com/es/nand-programmer-p13.html[/URL]

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Yes, I saw the P13. I have the JC main programmer, but I'll have to buy this one. Do I need any files from the old chips like Wifi, BT, Mac address...?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
P13 will initialize the NAND according with its position on the specific Macbook model.
You can find several videos about how to use it on Internet.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I received the programmer, waiting for new NANDs, I'll update you with the results since I also have another A1990 4 NANDs config that I need to replace :)

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
Hi. 

I'm back on this one. I received the SSD chips. 6 x 128GB TSB4228. In the package, they sent 6 chips of which one was from a different spot. I first tried to solder them as they were from the spots where they came from since the supplier advised us like that, but it didn't work. Then I took them out again, but this time I reprogrammed them with the P13 and for the first time the process of Revive went through and I get to the Lock sign as referred on the Wiki page. After I do the Revive it says the Apple Controller is Booted, but I cannot restore it, and even during the Revive process I don't get the Logo as normally should. I attached pictures of different variants of the process but I think it gets stuck on Exclusive Device Connection. Also, note that when I wanna reprogram the chips on P13 the only combinations that it shows are 1Tb and 512GB.

Any ideas would be appreciated. Thanks

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
You must go directly to DFU restore, when changed NANDs.
Your board had 1TB SSD (6 NANDs).

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I went to DFU restore with shorting out SWK003

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
Doesn't mother how do you get into DFU.
But you've only mentioned DFU revive, not restore.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I also tried to restore it, still didn't work

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: When I try to restore it It says State Booted as shown on the uploaded picture A2141 SSD 4, but nothing happens just stays like that no picture not taking power more than 5v, and if I remove the restore cable that goes to the working Mac it's gonna try to boot gets 20v but stays 0.30a

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I rechecked also the voltages going to the SSD and they are all present as they should be

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
Reflash SoC ROM and try again.

Be sure all components around NAND chips are in their place.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: All components are fine and checked. What do you mean flash SoC rom?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: U4770? bios you think got corrupted and not showing picture because of it?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
That is not BIOS, but important T2 information stored there.
Sometime DFU can't be completed because of its corruption.

Don't forget to make backup first.
Be aware, is 1.8V SPI chip.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I reprogrammed it but now it's stuck on 5v. Not sure if the file is the correct one.

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Just to recap... The laptop goes to 20v and also goes to DFU mode, that was before I reprogrammed it. I will change the file again and revert

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: I tried this file and another 3 , but only with the Original file goes up to 20v

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Can you complete DFU with this last dump?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Yes and it says Apple controller booted but no picture

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: This is with DFU mode, both ways it goes with KB buttons and with short on SKW003, and it comes to this

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Just to be clear the File that you sent me, was not accepted it stays on 5v like the others, only the original lets me get to the Booted state

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Can you check for USB activity?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: No USB activity

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: Do you get CPU core voltage (L7211)?

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message: No, I don't have. Once I plug it in now it stays 20v and 0.27a and goes back to 0amps

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700

title: MacBook A2141 820-01700
message:
[QUOTE="iFix, post: 95989, member: 20112"]
Hi.

I'm back on this one. I received the SSD chips. 6 x 128GB TSB4228. In the package, they sent 6 chips of which one was from a different spot. I first tried to solder them as they were from the spots where they came from since the supplier advised us like that, but it didn't work. Then I took them out again, but this time I reprogrammed them with the P13 and for the first time the process of Revive went through and I get to the Lock sign as referred on the Wiki page. After I do the Revive it says the Apple Controller is Booted, but I cannot restore it, and even during the Revive process I don't get the Logo as normally should. I attached pictures of different variants of the process but I think it gets stuck on Exclusive Device Connection. Also, note that when I wanna reprogram the chips on P13 the only combinations that it shows are 1Tb and 512GB.

Any ideas would be appreciated. Thanks
[/QUOTE]
You problem can be here.
You have 128G nand, or your configuration is 6, so you need 192G NAND.
